titleStmt.title: A remonstrance from Ireland, to the high court of Parliament in England. For the speedy oppression of the rebels, with little cost and losse of the protestant party, and the probable way of moving the rebels to submit themselves, and to cut one anothers throats, and to bring the heads of the chiefest actors, thereby to get their pardon presented by a membet [sic] of the House of Commons in Ireland. With a proclamation for proroguing of both Houses of Parliament at the city of Dublin, till the 11. of Ianuary next. With an order for the people all to repaire to their owne dwellings, there to defend the country with the best strength they can.
titleStmt.author: Ireland. Lord Justices and Council.

titleStmt.title: A remonstrance from Ireland, to the high court of Parliament in England. For the speedy oppression of the rebels, with little cost and losse of the protestant party, and the probable way of moving the rebels to submit themselves, and to cut one anothers throats, and to bring the heads of the chiefest actors, thereby to get their pardon presented by a membet [sic] of the House of Commons in Ireland. With a proclamation for proroguing of both Houses of Parliament at the city of Dublin, till the 11. of Ianuary next. With an order for the people all to repaire to their owne dwellings, there to defend the country with the best strength they can.
titleStmt.author: Ireland. Lord Justices and Council.

publicationStmt.publisher: First printed at Dublin, and now reprinted at London, and are to bee sold by R. Smithers,

notesStmt.note: Signed at end: Ormond Ossory [and eight others].
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
